media:group.media:title: Category Theory - Lecture 8 Part 1
media:group.media:description: In the video we define Kan extensions , then we see that left adjoints for a given functor are unique up to unique natural isomorphism. We see that, under some hypothesis, left/right Kan extensions can be seen as left/right adjoints to a precomposition functor, and we see an example of this from algebra.
